mpmToolbox.projectData.alignment.basicPitchLcsAligner

Class ObjectCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • mpmToolbox.projectData.alignment.basicPitchLcsAligner.ObjectCache

  • public class ObjectCache
extends java.lang.Object
    The ObjectCache class is a Java class that provides an in-memory cache for storing objects. The cache has a fixed maximum size, specified in the constructor. When the maximum size is reached, the least recently accessed object is removed from the cache to make space for new objects. The cache is implemented using SQLite, which is a lightweight, in-process relational database engine that allows the cache to persist even if the program is restarted.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ObjectCache

        public ObjectCache()
        Constructs a new in-memory ObjectCache instance with default maximum size.

      • ObjectCache

        public ObjectCache(java.lang.String dbFilePath,
                   long maxSize)
        Constructs a new ObjectCache instance with the specified database file path and maximum size.
        Parameters:
        dbFilePath - The file path to the SQLite database file that will be used to store the cache.
        maxSize - The maximum size of the cache, in bytes.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init(java.lang.String dbFilePath)
        Initializes the ObjectCache instance by creating the necessary database tables and preparing the SQL statements that will be used to interact with the database.
        Parameters:
        dbFilePath - The file path to the SQLite database file that will be used to store the cache.

      • put

        public void put(java.lang.String id,
                java.lang.Object obj)
         throws java.sql.SQLException,
                java.io.IOException,
                java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Stores the specified object in the cache with the given ID. If an object with the same ID already exists in the cache, it will be overwritten. If the cache is full, the least recently accessed object will be removed from the cache to make space for the new object.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the object to be stored in the cache.
        obj - The object to be stored in the cache.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
